Section titled â€œğŸ”§ Resource Scaling Strategyâ€

Staff Engineer Thinking: What Needs to Scale?

Section titled â€œStaff Engineer Thinking: What Needs to Scale?â€
ComponentDevelopmentStagingProductionScaling Rationale
Code-Server CPU100m â†’ 500m250m â†’ 1000m500m â†’ 4000mUser workloads grow with complexity
Code-Server Memory256Mi â†’ 1Gi512Mi â†’ 2Gi1Gi â†’ 8GiDevelopment projects need more RAM
Workspace Storage2Gi â†’ 5Gi max5Gi â†’ 20Gi max10Gi â†’ 50Gi maxProduction codebases are larger
Resource Quota CPU2 â†’ 8 cores10 â†’ 40 cores200 â†’ 800 coresConcurrent user scaling
Resource Quota Memory4Gi â†’ 16Gi20Gi â†’ 80Gi400Gi â†’ 1.6TiMemory-intensive workloads
Storage Total50Gi500Gi2TiData growth with user base
Pod Limits50 pods100 pods1000 podsHorizontal scaling needs

ğŸš€ Availability & Performance Scaling

Section titled â€œğŸš€ Availability & Performance Scalingâ€
FeatureDevStagingProduction
Ingress Replicas123
Auto-scalingâŒ Disabled1-5 replicas3-50 replicas

ğŸ’° Cost Optimization Strategy

Section titled â€œğŸ’° Cost Optimization Strategyâ€

Development - Cost Minimized

Section titled â€œDevelopment - Cost Minimizedâ€
  • Minimal resource requests (100m CPU, 256Mi RAM)
  • Standard storage (cheapest option)
  • No monitoring or alerting
  • Single replicas only
  • No TLS certificates (cost savings)

Staging - Production Parity

Section titled â€œStaging - Production Parityâ€
  • Medium resource allocation for realistic testing
  • Fast SSD storage for performance testing
  • Full monitoring to validate production setup
  • Multiple replicas to test HA scenarios
  • Staging TLS certificates (free)

Production - Performance & Reliability

Section titled â€œProduction - Performance & Reliabilityâ€
  • Generous resource limits with conservative requests
  • Premium SSD storage with retention policies
  • Full observability stack with long retention
  • High availability with anti-affinity rules
  • Production TLS certificates
  • Automatic scaling to handle load

ğŸ¯ Staff Engineer Decision Points

Section titled â€œğŸ¯ Staff Engineer Decision Pointsâ€

1. Resource Request vs Limit Strategy

Section titled â€œ1. Resource Request vs Limit Strategyâ€

2. Storage Scaling Decisions

Section titled â€œ2. Storage Scaling Decisionsâ€
  • Dev: 2Gi workspaces, standard storage class (delete on teardown)
  • Staging: 5Gi workspaces, ssd-fast storage class (retained)
  • Prod: 10Gi workspaces, premium-ssd-retained (retained + backup)

3. Security Posture Scaling

Section titled â€œ3. Security Posture Scalingâ€
  • Dev: baseline security (easier debugging)
  • Staging: restricted security (test prod security)
  • Prod: restricted + admission controllers + network policies

4. Monitoring & Observability

Section titled â€œ4. Monitoring & Observabilityâ€
  • Dev: Disabled (cost optimization)
  • Staging: Full monitoring, 7-day retention (validation)
  • Prod: Full stack, 30-day retention, alerting, backup

ğŸ§ª Testing Results

Section titled â€œğŸ§ª Testing Resultsâ€

Template Rendering

Section titled â€œTemplate Renderingâ€

Resource Allocation Validation

Section titled â€œResource Allocation Validationâ€
  • CPU scaling: 8x increase from dev to prod (100m â†’ 4000m)
  • Memory scaling: 32x increase from dev to prod (256Mi â†’ 8Gi)
  • Storage scaling: 5x increase from dev to prod (2Gi â†’ 10Gi workspaces)
  • Total cluster resources: 100x scaling (2 cores â†’ 200 cores)

Security Policy Validation

Section titled â€œSecurity Policy Validationâ€
  • Pod Security Standards: Progressive hardening (baseline â†’ restricted)
  • Network Policies: Enabled only where needed (staging/prod)
  • RBAC: Increasing strictness across environments

ğŸš¨ Common Scaling Pitfalls

Section titled â€œğŸš¨ Common Scaling Pitfallsâ€

1. Over-Provisioning Resources

Section titled â€œ1. Over-Provisioning Resourcesâ€

âŒ Wrong: 4 CPU cores for simple web apps
âœ… Right: Start with 100m, scale based on usage

2. Under-Provisioning Storage

Section titled â€œ2. Under-Provisioning Storageâ€

âŒ Wrong: 1Gi for modern JavaScript projects
âœ… Right: 5-10Gi default for development workspaces

3. Ignoring Security Scaling

Section titled â€œ3. Ignoring Security Scalingâ€

âŒ Wrong: Same security policies across all environments
âœ… Right: Progressive hardening (baseline â†’ restricted)

4. Not Planning for Growth

Section titled â€œ4. Not Planning for Growthâ€

âŒ Wrong: Static resource allocations
âœ… Right: Auto-scaling with reasonable min/max limits

âœ… Success Criteria

Section titled â€œâœ… Success Criteriaâ€

Development Environment

Section titled â€œDevelopment Environmentâ€
  • Deploy within 2 minutes
  • Support 5-10 concurrent developers
  • Total cost < $100/month
  • No production security restrictions

Staging Environment

Section titled â€œStaging Environmentâ€
  • Production-like performance
  • Support 10-20 concurrent testers
  • Full monitoring and alerting
  • Restricted security policies

Production Environment

Section titled â€œProduction Environmentâ€
  • 99.9% uptime SLA
  • Support 100+ concurrent users
  • Auto-scale 3-50 replicas
  • Enterprise security compliance
